item.value: Roughly 70 percent of an adult's body is made up of water.
The longest river is the Nile. It is 6,650 Km ( 4,132 miles ) long. It flows into the Mediterranean Sea.
The Amazon is the second longest river. It is 6.400 km ( 4,000 miles ) long. It flows into the Atlantic ocean.
Intel introduces the first microprocessor, the Intel 4004 on November 15, 1971.
The earth is the 3rd planet from the sun and is the 5th largest planet in our solar system.
The Cheetah is the fastest land animal. It can run at 112 kilometres per hour (70 mph). The average person can run from 12 - 17 miles an hour in sprints, so keep away from cheetahs.
English is the second most spoken language in the world.
The world's population grows by over 100 million each year.
About two thirds of the Earth's surface is covered with water.
There are 195 countries in the world and there are more than 2,700 languages.
There are more than 2,700 languages in the world.
The banana tree is not actually a tree, it is a herb. It bears fruit once a year and then dies.
The tallest woman was Zeng Jinlian. She was 2.48 meters ( 8ft 2in ) tall.
The blue whale is the largest known animal on Earth. Mature blue whales can measure anywhere from 75 feet (23 m) to 100 feet (30.5 m) long and can weigh as much as 150 tons.
The shortest woman was Pauline Muster. She was 58 cm ( 23 in ) tall.
New York is the city with the biggest population in America. It has over 8.3 million inhabitants. Los Angeles is in second place. It has 3.8 million people.
The tallest person in the world was Robert Wadlow. He was 2.72 meters ( 8ft 11in ) tall.
Gravity keeps Earth and the other planets in our solar system in orbit around the Sun. It also keeps the Moon in orbit around Earth.
Orville and Wilbur Wright achieved the first flight of an airplane.on the morning of December 17, 1903.
There are more than 2,700 languages ( + more than 7,000 dialects) in the world. More than 1,000 different languages are spoken on the continent of Africa.
